title: Q10 Revision G/U MC
prompt: Which of these is the <u>most</u> accurate and effective revision to the sentence?
description:
Read this sentence.

When power is restored, the maintenance staff will restore water flow; then check pipes for leaks from possible freeze damage.
feedback: The correct answer is: “When power is restored, the maintenance staff will restore water flow and then check pipes for leaks from possible freeze damage.” Using a semicolon is incorrect because “then check pipes for leaks from possible freeze damage” is a part of the compound predicate. It’s not a sentence that can stand on its own. For the same reason, it’s incorrect to make it a separate sentence! A semicolon before the word “and” is always incorrect. The correct answer is to use no punctuation and join the two parts of the predicate with the word “and.”
